subject: "Leading Inclusively" for an EMEA audience on 10 March?
body:
Hello, Almendra,  
How are you today? I know you’ve worked with others at LCW and I’ve heard great things about you!
I wanted to see if by chance you might be up to facilitating a “Leading Inclusively” workshop for one of our clients (a global medical devices company) for an EMEA (mostly European) audience on March 10
th
 from 11am to 2pm CET (with a 10 min break). We have already designed the content and facilitator notes.
Here’s the bad news - our budget is quite small at this time due to current strains to our industry, as I’m sure you’re well aware…. So we can’t pay our usual rates at this time. We cannot afford to pay more than $300 per hour of facilitation, so the total would be $300*3 = $900, including prep.
 
What do you think? 
Warmly,
Rebecca
 
Rebecca M. Parrilla
 
(MBA, Latina, LGBTQ, Mom)
(she/her) 
Why pronouns matter
Head of Client Solutions
We help develop the mindsets and systems needed to foster resilient, diverse, and equitable teams that will be successful in a cross-cultural world.
Website
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
I live and work in Chapel Hill, NC – on the traditional homelands of the Occaneechi, Shakori, Eno, and Sissipahaw peoples.

This event has been updated
Changed:
 description
 
  
 
Description
CHANGED
Hi Britelings, 
Thank you in advance for taking part in our focus group which will help Eventbrite design strategies to improve belonging.This is an opportunity to dive deeper into opportunities to ensure our organization is diverse, inclusive, and equitable for you and your teams.
It is critical to the DEI team that all individuals who join the focus groups participate in a way that makes them feel comfortable and safe to share their insights. Please know we have a strong commitment to maintaining confidentiality at the utmost level. We will NOT share any names or identifying information, but we will share the insights you provide. In addition, we willNOT be recording the sessions.
All focus groups are 1-hour in length and will be conducted virtually via Zoom.
Your focus group will be conducted on November 29th at 5:30 am PT.
We have partnered with LCW, a global training and consulting firm focused on intercultural competence, DEI, and debiasing talent processes, to lead the focus groups. 
We look forward to your participation and thank you again for partaking in our focus group. Should you have any questions at all, please reach out to me directly.
Thank you on behalf of Eventbrite and LCW.
If you have any questions at all please don't hesitate to reach out to Bridget Cincotta.

Dear Team,
 
Last month, I shared our excitement 
to continue our journey to deliver on our 
commitment and planned strategic actions to kick off a holistic approach to Strengthen Leadership Capabilities and continue to Build Inclusive Leadership skills.   
 
We are strategically investing time and resources to build these skills and capabilities. We
 
heard from you (
Our Voice/Credo Surveys
) that we have an opportunity to strengthen leadership capabilities and continue to equip everyone to foster a
 
culture of inclusion and support an environment
 
where each of you are considered a unique individual. 
 
In the spirit of learning together, you will receive a calendar invitation from me with the preferred options for our team to dedicate the time and space to engage in these conversations.  This session will be focused on 
The Power of Allyship
. 
We will offer 3 sessions to fit various global time zones, 
please plan to attend 1 of the 3 that are offered
. 
The Zoom link is enclosed in the “location” section of the meeting hold
.   Please note, these sessions 
will not
 be recorded due to the sensitive/proprietary nature of the contents. 
 
Thank you for your continued engagement and 
I encourage you to invest in your development and attend one these sessions
.  
 
Best,
Chris

We will offer 3 sessions to fit various global time zones, 
please plan to attend 1 of the 3 that are offered
. The Zoom link is enclosed in the “location” section of the meeting hold.  Please note, these sessions 
will 
not be recorded due to the sensitive/proprietary nature of the contents.
 
Thank you for your continued engagement and 
I encourage you to invest in your development and attend these sessions
.  
 
Best,
Chris

subject: RE: new client/project - June 20 availability
body:
Hi Almendra,
 
It’s great to hear from you, and I hope you have been well!
 
I’m sorry to say that Grace is no longer with LCW. However, I have taken over duties for this client, and I will definitely reach out to you in the future should we need someone outside of our in-house staff to facilitate for this. Right now, though, things are pretty quiet, so I don’t think I need to take up your time with a meeting to discuss them (just yet 
😊
).
 
All the best,
Vince

For right now it turns out that we will not need support on June 20, but we expect a good amount of these trainings with this client, so I’d still love to find time, bring you up to speed on the client, and get in a good place for when their requests start coming in. >
Subject:
 new client/project - June 20 availability
 
 
Hello Almendra,
 
It was so lovely to facilitate with you the other month! I was hoping to have an opportunity to work together again, and a new client need has come up. I am reaching out to see if you are both available and interested in supporting a few deliveries of our Understanding Microaggressions training. The courses will be delivered in English, but our client (the Inter-American Development Bank) is eager for a facilitator that can receive and answer questions in Spanish. I also think it will make the training even more effective.
 
Are you interested? And if you are, might you be available for an initial training on June 20 from 3-4:30 PM EST? 
 
I’d love to set up a quick time to chat through the project if you’re interested and able (even if you can’t make that specific time work) – let me know what you think!
 
Thanks,
Grace
 
------------------------------------------------------
Grace Vottero

Subject:
 new client/project - June 20 availability
 
 
Hello Almendra,
 
It was so lovely to facilitate with you the other month! I was hoping to have an opportunity to work together again, and a new client need has come up. I am reaching out to see if you are both available and interested in supporting a few deliveries of our Understanding Microaggressions training. The courses will be delivered in English, but our client (the Inter-American Development Bank) is eager for a facilitator that can receive and answer questions in Spanish. I also think it will make the training even more effective.
 
Are you interested? And if you are, might you be available for an initial training on June 20 from 3-4:30 PM EST? 
 
I’d love to set up a quick time to chat through the project if you’re interested and able (even if you can’t make that specific time work) – let me know what you think!
 
Thanks,
Grace

subject: RE: new client/project - June 20 availability
body:
Hello Almendra, thank you so much for your reply and enthusiasm! My apologies for a slow return on my side, it’s been a very busy week…
For right now it turns out that we will not need support on June 20, but we expect a good amount of these trainings with this client, so I’d still love to find time, bring you up to speed on the client, and get in a good place for when their requests start coming in. This coming week and a half is exceptionally busy for us as we head to Chicago for our retreat. Could you meet on June 1
st
 or 2
nd
 to talk through the project?
 
Talk to you soon!
 
Best,
Grace

subject: RE: Advancing Inclusion - Mid-point Check-in
body:
Hi Almendra and Anais, 
 
I will not be able to attend this session as I have already multiple meetings booked during that time. Apologies for that. 
 
Best regards, 
Desiree Tan 
 
Truly Human Notice: Getting this email outside of working hours? We work in a digitally-enabled relentless pace, which can disrupt our ability to sleep enough, eat right, exercise or spend time with people who matter most. subject: Cambios en las Condiciones de servicio y la Política de privacidad
body:
Hola, Almendra:
Buscamos constantemente maneras de mejorar la experiencia de Dropbox y ampliar nuestras ofertas de funciones. En los últimos años, hemos dado la bienvenida a HelloSign, ahora Dropbox Sign, y a DocSend a la familia de Dropbox, y ahora ofreceremos estos servicios como parte integrada de Dropbox. Si aún no has utilizado estos servicios, ahora podrás acceder a ellos desde tu cuenta de Dropbox. Estamos realizando algunas actualizaciones en nuestras Condiciones del servicio y Política de privacidad para reflejar estos y algunos otros cambios:
Condiciones del servicio
•
Hemos añadido información sobre el uso de los servicios Dropbox Sign y DocSend.
•
También hemos incorporado aclaraciones sobre cuáles son tus responsabilidades en caso de que decidas habilitar integraciones de terceros con Dropbox.
•
Ahora nos referimos a los equipos de Dropbox Business como "equipos de Dropbox" y hemos actualizado las Condiciones del servicio en consecuencia.
Política de privacidad
•
Hemos añadido información para explicar cómo funciona la recopilación de datos si utilizas DocSend, las estadísticas de visualización del contenido de Dropbox o nuestros servicios de firma electrónica.
•
También hemos aclarado cómo utilizamos tus datos cuando interactúas con los representantes de Dropbox en determinados contextos de marketing.
•
Ahora nos referimos a los equipos de Dropbox Business como "equipos de Dropbox" y hemos actualizado la Política de privacidad en consecuencia.
Echa un vistazo a las 
Condiciones del servicio
 y a la 
Política de privacidad
 completas. Entrarán en vigor el 3 de abril de 2023. Si continúas usando Dropbox después de esa fecha, significará que aceptas las nuevas condiciones. Puedes consultar nuestras condiciones previas 
aquí
. Para obtener más información, visita nuestro 
Centro de ayuda
.
¡Gracias!
- El equipo de Dropbox

subject: LCW Exec Relocation
body:
Hello Almendra,
 
I hope you are doing well, I’m looking forward to connecting with you next week to update on the NBCU Part 2 content for the Theatrical Dubbing teams. I’ll forward you the deck today. It runs similarly to Conscious Inclusion so I think it shouldn’t be too unfamiliar.
 
I’m writing today because we have a client who has a new CEO coming in from Italy to the US; and while he has worked globally, this will be his first time living and working in the US and leading a US team that has a strong DEI commitment. The goal is to have a 4-hour session with an IDI to be delivered before February 27
th
.
 
If you are interested, could you please send me availability that we could offer the client where you can dedicate 4 hours. We could compensate you at a rate of $2,000.
 
Please let me know if this is something you’d like to take on and your availability.
 
Tamara
 
 
-
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tamara Thorpe (she/her)
Principal Consultant, LCW
Email: t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
Phone: +1-773-888-4942

Subject:

Hello Almendra,
 
Thank you so much for these reflections. We are working on ideating how we want to move forward now that we have gotten to do both debriefs so we can set up participants for success.
 
I’ll let me know if we have further questions, but this assessment is great for now.

From:
 Almendra Staffa-Healey <a.staffahealey@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, September 29, 2022 10:25 AM
To:
 Ada Vargas <a.vargas@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Raphaëlle Lalo <raphaelle.lalo@ubisoft.com>; Jeffrey Cookson <j.cookson@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Feedback regarding the Ubisoft check in
 
Dear Ada,
I just wanted to get you some of my notes and reflections regarding my Ubisoft check in. I'm cc'ing in Raphaëlle, and am also sharing with Jeffrey, so that he can have the information too.
 
Raphaëlle and I met briefly before the start, and she gave me some information regarding the mood of the group. She mentioned that this has been a fairly hectic time for them, especially in HR as there has been a lot of pressure on their side. We decided to ask permission to record the session so she could view it later as she wasn't going to be able to attend.  We also agreed that I would share that I knew that things were hectic because Raphaëlle and I had spoken. 
 
There were 4 participants for the first 1/2 hour and then we were joined by a 5th. They agreed that it was OK to record. They also indicated that they hadn't started lesson 3 yet as they've had it for 2 days. The general mood was collaborative, open and reflective.
 
Earlier this morning I shared the recording with Raphaëlle.
 
My key take-aways from the meta conversation on the learning program were:
a greater need for constraint in terms of timing and an increase in remainders. Because of the stress of the HR job, to ensure better support for the autonomous work so that it gets done
lesson 1 had a much larger scope of work than lesson 2, also some readings were very long. The level of challenge on lesson one was greater too than lesson 2
the pair work was very valuable, when followed. Sarah Hinchcliffe-Smith mentioned that she doesn't have a partner and is looking forward to getting one
the content and reflection were very eye-opening, they appreciate the challenge of the work
enjoyment over the IDI debriefs and learning about own levels of competency and areas for growth and development
testimonials are very helpful and bring to life the experiences of the cultures represented
I actually started with a discussion on lesson 2 first and then we went to lesson 1 as lesson 2 was more present for them. 
 
In addition to this, during the discussion, Antonine Bocage-Marchand indicated that he doesn't see the DEI strategy, perhaps it is being discussed higher up with regards to policies regarding disabilities and race/ethnicity, however the only place he recognizes it being addressed is in relation to ERGs. 
 
It seemed as if others were more aware of the strategy; a little hard to tell though. My recommendation is to check in with HR managers to make sure that they are aware of the strategy, provided that there have been decisions made that will help them to better carry out their roles. 
 
If any of you have questions about this or would like further details, do please let me know.
 
All the best, and I hope today's afternoon check in goes well!
-Almendra

I’ll let me know if we have further questions, but this assessment is great for now.
 
Thanks again,

From:
 Almendra Staffa-Healey <a.staffahealey@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, September 29, 2022 10:25 AM
To:
 Ada Vargas <a.vargas@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Raphaëlle Lalo <raphaelle.lalo@ubisoft.com>; Jeffrey Cookson <j.cookson@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Feedback regarding the Ubisoft check in
 
Dear Ada,
I just wanted to get you some of my notes and reflections regarding my Ubisoft check in. I'm cc'ing in Raphaëlle, and am also sharing with Jeffrey, so that he can have the information too.
 
Raphaëlle and I met briefly before the start, and she gave me some information regarding the mood of the group. She mentioned that this has been a fairly hectic time for them, especially in HR as there has been a lot of pressure on their side. We decided to ask permission to record the session so she could view it later as she wasn't going to be able to attend.  We also agreed that I would share that I knew that things were hectic because Raphaëlle and I had spoken. 
 
There were 4 participants for the first 1/2 hour and then we were joined by a 5th. They agreed that it was OK to record. They also indicated that they hadn't started lesson 3 yet as they've had it for 2 days. The general mood was collaborative, open and reflective.
 
Earlier this morning I shared the recording with Raphaëlle.
 
My key take-aways from the meta conversation on the learning program were:
a greater need for constraint in terms of timing and an increase in remainders. Because of the stress of the HR job, to ensure better support for the autonomous work so that it gets done
lesson 1 had a much larger scope of work than lesson 2, also some readings were very long. The level of challenge on lesson one was greater too than lesson 2
the pair work was very valuable, when followed. Sarah Hinchcliffe-Smith mentioned that she doesn't have a partner and is looking forward to getting one
the content and reflection were very eye-opening, they appreciate the challenge of the work
enjoyment over the IDI debriefs and learning about own levels of competency and areas for growth and development
testimonials are very helpful and bring to life the experiences of the cultures represented
I actually started with a discussion on lesson 2 first and then we went to lesson 1 as lesson 2 was more present for them. 
 
In addition to this, during the discussion, Antonine Bocage-Marchand indicated that he doesn't see the DEI strategy, perhaps it is being discussed higher up with regards to policies regarding disabilities and race/ethnicity, however the only place he recognizes it being addressed is in relation to ERGs. 
 
It seemed as if others were more aware of the strategy; a little hard to tell though. My recommendation is to check in with HR managers to make sure that they are aware of the strategy, provided that there have been decisions made that will help them to better carry out their roles. 
 
If any of you have questions about this or would like further details, do please let me know.
 
All the best, and I hope today's afternoon check in goes well!
-Almendra
